meanings.definition: To bring together or focus on a central point.
meanings.sent1: I will concentrate all my toys in one box.
meanings.sent2: Please concentrate on your homework to finish it quickly.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to concentrate all their energy on building a sandcastle.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts started to concentrate like a magnifying glass on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to concentrate on the lesson to understand it better.

meanings.definition: To make more intense or stronger.
meanings.sent1: She will concentrate the flavors by adding more spices.
meanings.sent2: The storm will concentrate its power as it moves closer.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to concentrate his magic to make the trick more impressive.
meanings.sent4: His determination concentrated like a laser beam, cutting through obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight will concentrate its warmth on the garden, helping the plants grow.

meanings.definition: A substance in which the components are present in a concentrated form.
meanings.sent1: The orange juice concentrate is used to make a refreshing drink.
meanings.sent2: The detergent concentrate is more effective at cleaning stains.
meanings.sent3: The chef spilled the fruit concentrate, making the kitchen smell fruity.
meanings.sent4: The perfume concentrate filled the room with a strong floral scent.
meanings.sent5: The medicine concentrate is diluted before consumption to reduce its strength.
